habitat_description:
The range of the false map turtle is in rivers of the Mississippi River Basin, from the St. Croix and Wisconsin River in Minnesota south through Louisiana and eastern Texas, following the Missouri River into North Dakota and east to parts of western Kentucky, Indiana, and central Ohio (Vogt 1993). Populations of introduced turtles have established in southeastern Virginia (subspecies kohnii) (Savitzky and Mitchell 2001). Habitats include lakes, ponds, reservoirs, sloughs, rivers and their backwaters, favoring areas with abundant aquatic vegetation. It is benthic, burrows in or using soil, fallen logs or debris sites (Fuselier and Edds 1994). 

In Kentucky, It occurs in areas with abundant basking sites and basks away from shore (Fuselier and Edds 1994). Hibernation occurs under water in bottom mud, in muskrat den, or behind rocks and logs on the bottom. Lays eggs about 100 meters from water, but usually close to water in nests dug in sandbars, islands, and beaches (Fuselier and Edds 1994).
